intro: Aira malatrina, commonly known as the Malatran grass, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, preferring cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-green hue, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Aira malatrina is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to alpine ecosystems.
